content: marshall frady the reporter who became the unofficial chronicler of the civil rights movement here recreates the life and turbulent times of its inspirational leader deftly interweaving the story of kings quest with a history of the african american struggle for equality frady offers fascinating insights into his subjects magnetic character with its mixture of piety and ambition he explores the complexities of kings relationships with other civil rights leaders the kennedy and johnson administrations and the fbis j edgar hoover who conducted a relentless vendetta against him the result is a biography that conveys not just the facts of kings life but the power of his legacy
title: martin luther king jr a life penguin lives biographies
